lead_paragraph: Paola Infante lives with her 4-year-old daughter, Geraliz, who has autism, and her 8-month-old son, Joshua, who needs heart surgery, in a small Manhattan apartment with the kitchen in the living room.

headline.print_headline: Raising 2 Children With High Needs, in a Space That Doesn’t Feel Big Enough
headline.main: Raising 2 Young Children by Herself, in a Space That Feels Not Big Enough

snippet: Paola Infante lives with her 4-year-old daughter, Geraliz, who has autism, and her 8-month-old son, Joshua, who needs heart surgery, in a small Manhattan apartment with the kitchen in the living room....
abstract: Catholic Charities Archdiocese of New York, one of eight organizations supported by The New York Times Neediest Cases Fund, helps Paola Infante of Upper Manhattan meet household expenses, enroll in English classes and find care for her children with disabilities.

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: New York Times Neediest Cases Fund

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Catholic Charities Archdiocese of New York
